H0.text: In 1973 the Paris Peace Accords were held in an attempt to end which war. Vietnam

H1.text: In 1973 the Paris Peace Accords were held in an attempt to end which war. Korean

H2.text: In 1973 the Paris Peace Accords were held in an attempt to end which war. Cold

H3.text: In 1973 the Paris Peace Accords were held in an attempt to end which war. SRVN

A4.text: The Paris Peace Accords (Vietnamese: Hiệp định Paris về Việt Nam, lit. 'Paris Treat about Vietnam'), officially the Agreement on ending the war and restoring peace in Viet-Nam (Hiệp định về chấm dứt chiến tranh, lập lại hòa bình ở Việt Nam), was a peace agreement signed on 27 January 1973 to establish peace in Vietnam and end the Vietnam War.

A5.text: The agreement was signed by the Democratic Republic of Vietnam (North Vietnam), the Republic of Vietnam (South Vietnam), the Provisional Revolutionary Government (PRG), and the United States.
